PyMetaParticleSystem Class Reference

This class is the python wrapper for MetaParticleSystem. More...

#include <py_meta_particle_system.hpp>

static PyFactoryMethodLink s_link_pyNew = PyFactoryMethodLink( "Pixie", "MetaParticleSystem" , & PyMetaParticleSystem ::s_type_ )

create - this method creates either Meta or standard Particle systems,

as such it is only particularly useful for python scripts.

static PyObject * create (const std::string &filename)
static PyObject * _py_create (PyObject *, PyObject *args)
static PyModuleMethodLink s_link_py_create

createBG - this method creates a Meta or

Particle systems in the background thread

static PyObject * createBG (const std::string &filename, PyObjectPtr callback)
 This method implements the python Pixie.createBG method, it creates a particle system in the background thread and then calls a callback function with the results.
static PyObject * _py_createBG (PyObject *, PyObject *args)
static PyModuleMethodLink s_link_py_createBG

Detailed Description

This class is the python wrapper for MetaParticleSystem.

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::create ( const std::string &  filename  )  [static]

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::createBG ( const std::string &  filename,
PyObjectPtr  callback 
) [static]

This method implements the python Pixie.createBG method, it creates a particle system in the background thread and then calls a callback function with the results.

Parameters:
filename name of the particle system to load.
callback callback function that takes one parameter (a PyMetaParticleSystem)
Returns:
NULL

void PyMetaParticleSystem::detach (  )  [virtual]

This method overrides PyAttachment and delegates directly to our system.

Reimplemented from PyAttachment.

void PyMetaParticleSystem::draw ( const Matrix &  world,
float  lod 
) [virtual]

This methods tells the particle system to draw itself.

Particles are stored in world coordinates so we do not need the attachment transform which is passed in.

Implements PyAttachment.

MetaParticleSystemPtr PyMetaParticleSystem::pSystem (  )  [inline]

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::py_addSystem ( PyObject *  args  ) 

This Python method allows the script to add a system to the meta particle system.

Parameters:
args The list of parameters passed from Python. This should be a reference to an instance of ParticleSystem.

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::py_clear ( PyObject *  args  ) 

Python-accessible wrapper for the clear method.

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::py_force ( PyObject *  args  ) 

Python-accessible wrapper for the spawn method.

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::py_load ( PyObject *  args  ) 

Python-accessible load method.

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::py_removeAllSystems ( PyObject *  args  ) 

This Python method allows the script to tell the meta particle system to remove all particle systems from itself.

Parameters:
args The list of parameters passed from Python. None are expected or checked.

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::py_removeSystem ( PyObject *  args  ) 

This Python method allows the script to remove a system from the meta particle system.

Parameters:
args The list of parameters passed from Python. This could either be the name of the system to be removed or a reference to an instance of ParticleSystem.

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::py_render ( PyObject *  args  ) 

Python-accessible render method.

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::py_save ( PyObject *  args  ) 

Python-accessible save method.

PyObject * PyMetaParticleSystem::py_system ( PyObject *  args  ) 

This Python method allows the script to access a system in the meta particle system.

Parameters:
args The list of parameters passed from Python. This should be a string name of the system.
Returns:
A reference to the ParticleSystem if found or None if none of that type of action belongs in the particle system.
